Subjective: Constipation for 3 months. Difficulty passing hard stools, every 2-3 days. Abdominal cramps, painful to palpation. Bloating, stomach more swollen than usual. Reports being underweight, no recent weight loss. Family history of low weight, no prior workup. Negatives: No blood in stool, no change in eating/drinking habits, normal urination, regular menses (started late). Social: Lives with family, sister has ulcerative colitis. ICE: Concerned about seriousness, wants to soften stools.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds. Tympany on percussion, some dullness on percussion in LLQ. Palpation: Sensitive in LLQ, non-tender elsewhere. No tenderness in renal lodges. Lungs: Clear. Vitals: Not provided.
Assessment: Constipation, likely secondary to Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS-C). Ruled out: Serious pathology (no alarm symptoms).
Plan: 1. Psyllium fiber sachets daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 2. Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate. 3. Safety netting: Return sooner if worsening abdominal pain, fever, or significant blood in stool. 4. Discuss dietician referral at next visit.
